content.text:
Can you add an DEPARTMENT if there are no EMPLOYEEs in the database in <image 1>?

A. Yes
B. No
C. Can't tell

B. No

In the database schema shown in the image, the DEparment table (DEPARTMENT) has a foreign key constraint on the EMPLOYEE table (EMPLOYEE) through the column Dnumber. This means that every department in the DEparment table must have an associated employee ( in the EMPLOYEE table. Therefore, it is not possible to add a department if there are no employees in the database.
Now, output the final answer and nothing else:
